_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Sunny Fresh Foods policy is to comply with all applicable laws and regulations; champion waste reduction, energy conservation, and protection of the environment.  Leadership in environmental protection is key to our stakeholders, customers and the communities in which we do business.  We strive to exceed federal, state and local standards in the operation of our facilities.  Our core purpose is to be the supplier of choice to our customers world wide.  Our core values are Food Safety, Stakeholder Safety, Customer Focus, Quality, Stakeholder Focus and Ethics.
This facility utilizes shell eggs to produce value added egg products for the food service industry.  Anhydrous Ammonia is used in the refrigeration system to maintain and control temperature in our manufacturing process.  This ensures that our products are maintained at proper temperature to inhibit microbiological growth.  
We comply with OSHA Process Safety Management, OSHA Emergency Action Plan, Emergency Response and applicable EPCRA regulations.
The local fire department tours on a regular basis and reviews key points on the operation of the refrigeration system.  Drills are conducted on a regular basis with all stakeholders.  A critique is an essential part of the drill and deficiencies are corrected.
This is a new system and maintenance, both preventive and predictive, guidelines will be established as the system is brought on line.  The basis for preventive maintenance will be manufacturing guidelines and standards set by IIAR, ASHRAE and ANSI.  Management of Change (MOC) and Pre Start Safety Review (PSSR) are principles that are deployed to all of our processes to ensure safe operation and design.  Contractors are required to submit information that will approve them to work for Sunny Fresh.  This information includes financial, safety and training requirements.  Once bid and approval has been secured, orientation for these contractors is conducted prior to beginning work.  
Sunny Fresh, Big Lake, is a

new facility and has had no reportable accidents.  
We prevent accidents by designing for safety, maintaining our plant, operating safely, auditing our safety and environmental management systems and training of stakeholders.  This system has been installed with automated process controls.  A consultant was retained to conduct the Process Hazard Analysis of this system and will be utilized to conduct future compliance audits of the system.
We continously review industry practices and benchmark for applicable best practices to improve our systems to make it safer for our stakeholders and the surrounding communities.
